instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: repair flexgate macbook pro 13 2017
threads.message: Well, I repair the flexgate of this computer the problem is solved that does not have video but has another problem in the lower lighting, I would like to know if you have any idea problem if it will be a problem with the screen or the same cable badly repaired or other problem. I do not have another screen with which to test, attached image of the problem.thanks[ATTACH type="full" alt="PHOTO-2021-12-24-09-02-45.jpg"]60342[/ATTACH]

threads.title: repair flexgate macbook pro 13 2017
threads.message: That is an issue with the backlight cable on the screen. Should be an issue with one or more of the LED return lines for the backlight. Check the repair you did on that cable. This may be useful for you. [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/A1708_TConn_Backlight_Pinout_(FlexGate)[/URL]

threads.title: repair flexgate macbook pro 13 2017
threads.message:
in fact it is a problem of bad welding in the lines. It may be due to the type of wire you use to make the bridges.

It has happened to me before.

threads.title: repair flexgate macbook pro 13 2017
threads.message: I have the exact same issue after backligt flex repair on an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Any advice on how this can be prevented?

threads.title: repair flexgate macbook pro 13 2017
threads.message: Okay, I've found the problem. There was a short between <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL> and GND. It was not visible, I guess a tiny little bit of solder ran into the gap between the old and the new flex cable. I have reworked it and the backlight looks perfect now. Many thanks to [B][USER=7922]tcampbell34[/USER] [/B]for the link. (y)ðŸ˜Š
